All Implemented Interfaces:
TreeNode
public class SimpleNode
extends SuffixNode
implements TreeNode

Node Class for the suffix tree, implementing an Interface for LCA-queries

Author:
Francois Pepin (original version from BioJava API), Fabian Steeg (fsteeg)

isTerminal

public boolean isTerminal()
Description copied from class: SuffixNode
Determine is this node is terminal (has no children).

Note that this only happens at the terminated node (if the sequences have been terminated.

Specified by:
isTerminal in class SuffixNode
Returns:
true if and only if this node has no children.

getChild

public SuffixNode getChild(java.lang.Character x)
Description copied from class: SuffixNode
Gets the child of of a node that is coming down from that particular node. It returns null if no child exists or if no child exists starting on that particular character.

Specified by:
getChild in class SuffixNode
Parameters:
x - the first Character of the edge coming down this node
Returns:
the appropriate child SuffixNode, or null if it doesn't exists.
See Also:
SuffixNode.getChild(java.lang.Character)

acceptDFSNum

public void acceptDFSNum(int x)
Description copied from interface: TreeNode
Accept a number by which this node is to be identified to the LCA algorithm when we want to find an LCA. This is actually the number of this node in depth first search order, starting at 1. This callback is only made when the tree is fed to the LCA algorithm.

Specified by:
acceptDFSNum in interface TreeNode
Parameters:
x - the number used to identify this node to the LCA algorithm when looking for ancestors.
See Also:
TreeNode.acceptDFSNum(int)

Specified by:
getDFSNum in interface TreeNode
See Also:
TreeNode.getDFSNum()
